meanings.definition: A small, dense thicket or copse of trees.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel hid in the shaugh to escape the rain.
meanings.sent2: We had a picnic under the shaugh of willow trees.
meanings.sent3: The birds built their nests in the shaugh, creating a cozy neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The shaugh whispered secrets to the passing breeze.
meanings.sent5: The shaugh was a green fortress, protecting the creatures within.

meanings.sent1: The cat will shaugh across the room to catch the toy.
meanings.sent2: I saw the rabbit shaugh out of the bushes and into the field.
meanings.sent3: The wind made the leaves shaugh in a playful dance.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter made her whole body shaugh with joy.
meanings.sent5: The sudden noise made him shaugh in surprise.

meanings.definition: A loud, shrill cry or sound.
meanings.sent1: The shaugh of the eagle echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The shaugh of the whistle signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent3: The baby's shaugh of delight filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent4: The shaugh of the storm warned of its arrival.
meanings.sent5: The shaugh of the peacock impressed all who heard it.
